title: 114_hr3614
content: The "Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2015" includes provisions for airport improvement programs, extension of expiring authorities, FAA operations, air navigation facilities, research and development, funding for aviation programs, and essential air service. It also covers revenue provisions related to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund. SEC. 101 of the "Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2015" authorizes $1,675,000,000 for airport improvement programs from October 1, 2015, to March 31, 2016. The funds can be obligated until September 30, 2016, and remain available for expenditure. The Administrator of the Federal Aviation is responsible for program implementation and funding apportionments. The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration is directed to calculate funding apportionments as if the total amount available for fiscal year 2016 were $3,350,000,000, then reduce by 50 percent. Section 47104(c) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to extend project grant authority until March 31, 2016. Section 47107(r)(3) is also amended to extend expiring authorities until April 1, 2016. The legislation amends various sections of title 49 and title 51 of the United States Code by changing dates from October 1, 2015, to April 1, 2016, and from September 30, 2015, to March 31, 2016, for funding and project grant authority. The legislation amends sections of title 49 and title 51 of the United States Code by changing dates for funding and project grant authority from October 1, 2015, to March 31, 2016. Section 106(k) of title 49, United States Code is amended to allocate $4,870,350,000 for the period from October 1, 2015, to March 31, 2016. Section 48101(a) is also amended to allocate $1,300,000,000 for the same period. SEC. 105 amends Section 48102(a) of title 49, US Code, allocating $78,375,000 from October 1, 2015, to March 31, 2016 for research, engineering, and development. SEC. 106 amends Section 48114, allocating funds for aviation programs in 2016. Compliance with funding requirements is ensured by the budget authority authorized in this Act. Section 41742(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to allocate $77,500,000 for the Essential Air Service from October 1, 2015, to March 31, 2016. TITLE II--REVENUE PROVISIONS SEC. 201 amends the expenditure authority from the Airport and Airway Trust Fund by changing dates. SEC. 202 extends fuel and ticket taxes funding the Airport and Airway Trust Fund by changing dates. SEC. 201 and SEC. 202 amend dates related to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, changing them to March 31, 2016 and April 1, 2016 respectively.
